title: Commending the Sullivan County Music Educators' Association on its 57th Annual All-County Music Festival
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending the Sullivan County Music Educators'
Association upon the  occasion  of  its  57th  Annual  All-County  Music
Festival, to be held on March 5, 2011

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that music contributes
significantly  to  the  cultural  enrichment  and quality of life in the
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Events that foster community spirit and cooperation merit the
recognition of this Legislative Body; and
  WHEREAS, Music has evolved to be an important part of the education of
the young people of New York State; and
  WHEREAS, The young people of Sullivan County, the 42nd Senate District
and the 98th Assembly District of the State  of  New  York  have  demon-
strated exceptional talent in musical pursuits; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Sullivan  County  music educators have come together to
form the Sullivan County Music Educators' Association in  an  effort  to
improve  and  expand  the  many  talents of the young people of Sullivan
County; and
  WHEREAS, The  Association  has  banded  together  the  Central  school
districts  of  Eldred, Fallsburg, Liberty, Livingston Manor, Monticello,
Roscoe, Sullivan West, and Tri-Valley; and
  WHEREAS, The students from these schools have come together and  dili-
gently  practice  in the areas of Elementary Chorus, Middle School Band,
String Orchestra, Junior High Band, Senior High  Jazz  Ensemble,  Senior
High Women's Chorus, and Senior Mixed Chorus; and
  WHEREAS, The culmination of their efforts will be held at the Sullivan
County  Music  Educators'  Association's  57th  Annual  All-County Music
Festival on March 5, 2011 in the Bernstein Auditorium at the  Tri-Valley
High School; and
  WHEREAS, This festival is illustrative of the commitment of the admin-
istrators  of  all  eight  Sullivan County School Districts to provide a
full and comprehensive music program in their districts; and
  WHEREAS, Regina Hartman, Festival Chairperson; Michael  Mingo,  Presi-
dent  of  the  Sullivan  County  Music Educators' Association; the music
educators of all eight Sullivan County schools; and all those  who  will
perform on March 5, 2011 and their parents are to be commended for their
efforts  in  planning,  preparing  for  and presenting a musical program
which will bring pleasure to all those in attendance; now, therefore, be
it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  the  "All County Music Festival" to be held at Liberty High
School on March 5, 2011; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Lawrence Thomas,  Sullivan  County  BOCES  Superintendent  of
Schools;  Brian Edwards, President of the Tri-Valley CSD Board of Educa-
tion; Thomas Palmer, Tri-Valley Central School  District  Superintendent
of  Schools;  Jeffrey  Bennett,  Tri-Valley  Secondary School Principal;
Regina Hartman, SCMEA All-County Festival  Chairperson;  Michael  Mingo,
President  of  the Sullivan County Music Educators' Association and Gary
Siegel, NYSSMA/SCMEA GRC/Advocacy Committee Representative.
